Not just any astronomer \u2014 I wanted to be like 'Ellie' from the movie ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("em",{children:"Contact (1997)"}),". I dreamed of decoding signals from space and traveling through wormholes. That dream led me to major in Astronomy and Space Science at Sejong University. But as time passed, I started to question: could I really live a life like Ellie\u2019s?"]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs(_Fragment,{children:["So I took a small detour. I picked up ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"Japanese"})," as a second major, and then headed to China to study ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"Chinese"}),". I wanted to see more of the world and test my limits. I studied business in Shanghai, passed the HSK Level 5 exam, and learned how to survive on my own in a new culture. ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("em",{children:"It was hard, but it made me strong."})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs(_Fragment,{children:["Back in Korea, I stumbled into a course on ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"Astronomical Image Processing"}),", where I encountered ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"C programming"})," for the first time. It felt like discovering a new universe. Numbers turning into images, lines of code becoming stars \u2014 I was fascinated. That summer, I stayed up late in the university lab, learning how to code with a sense of curiosity I hadn\u2019t felt in a long time."]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs(_Fragment,{children:["That curiosity became conviction. I joined a ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"Java development course"}),", studied Android development, and soon found myself writing software instead of observing the stars. Since then, I\u2019ve worked in different countries\u2014Korea, China, Taiwan\u2014building data systems, mobile apps, dashboards, and even 3D visualization tools for scientific research. I learned how to manage teams, lead projects, and talk to both developers and non-developers alike."]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs(_Fragment,{children:["I\u2019ve been a ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"full-time employee"}),", a ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"freelancer"}),", a ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"mentor"}),", and a ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"solo creator"}),". From somewhere in the middle of this long journey, my son has been by my side, and now we live together in Canada. I still deeply love what I do, but I also enjoy writing essays, creating pixel-art games, and imagining new worlds. My path has never been a straight line, but I believe that\u2019s what has added more color to who I am."]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(_Fragment,{children:"And I still dream \u2014 not of decoding signals from space anymore, but of building things that mean something, even if it\u2019s just for one person."}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs(_Fragment,{children:["I\u2019m always looking for ",/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("strong",{children:"meaningful work"})," with thoughtful people. sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; import { useLanguage } from "../context/LanguageContext"; export default function About() { const { language } = useLanguage(); const paragraphs = { en: [ <> When I was younger, I wanted to become an astronomer. Not just any astronomer â€” I wanted to be like 'Ellie' from the movie Contact (1997). I dreamed of decoding signals from space and traveling through wormholes. That dream led me to major in Astronomy and Space Science at Sejong University. But as time passed, I started to question: could I really live a life like Ellieâ€™s? , <> So I took a small detour. I picked up Japanese as a second major, and then headed to China to study Chinese. I wanted to see more of the world and test my limits. I studied business in Shanghai, passed the HSK Level 5 exam, and learned how to survive on my own in a new culture. It was hard, but it made me strong. , <> Back in Korea, I stumbled into a course on Astronomical Image Processing, where I encountered C programming for the first time. It felt like discovering a new universe. Numbers turning into images, lines of code becoming stars â€” I was fascinated. That summer, I stayed up late in the university lab, learning how to code with a sense of curiosity I hadnâ€™t felt in a long time. , <> That curiosity became conviction. I joined a Java development course, studied Android development, and soon found myself writing software instead of observing the stars. Since then, Iâ€™ve worked in different countriesâ€”Korea, China, Taiwanâ€”building data systems, mobile apps, dashboards, and even 3D visualization tools for scientific research. I learned how to manage teams, lead projects, and talk to both developers and non-developers alike. , <> Iâ€™ve been a full-time employee, a freelancer, a mentor, and a solo creator. From somewhere in the middle of this long journey, my son has been by my side, and now we live together in Canada. I still deeply love what I do, but I also enjoy writing essays, creating pixel-art games, and imagining new worlds.
